statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Kris Acox scored a career-high 25 points on 12-of-14 shooting, including his 1,000th career point, and Furman held off Wofford 78-69 on Saturday to snap a two-game skid and remain locked in a top
article.headline: Furman beats Wofford 78-69  behind Acox's career-best 25
article.linkText: Furman beats Wofford 78-69  behind Acox's career-best 25
article.story: GREENVILLE, S.C. -- Kris Acox scored a career-high 25 points on 12-of-14 shooting, including his 1,000th career point, and Furman held off Wofford 78-69 on Saturday to snap a two-game skid and remain locked in a top-three finish in Southern Conference standings. Geoff Beans hit a career-high six 3-pointers for 18 points for the Paladins (21-10, 14-4), who can still win a share of the conference regular season title. Cameron Jackson's layup put Wofford up 52-46 early in the second half. Acox made back-to-back layups and a dunk and Furman led 55-54 with 11:52 left. Wofford led 58-57 after Fletcher Magee's 3 and free throw, trailed, then tied it at 60 on Derrick Brooks' layup. Jonathan Jean and Devin Sibley made layups, Bean hit his sixth 3-pointer, and Furman led 67-60 with 5:22 left. Wofford closed to 71-68 on Brooks' two free throws with 1:35 left but go no closer. Jackson scored 24 points with 10 rebounds for Wofford (15-16, 10-8), which saw its two-game win streak end.
